title: Using accumulation of rate to find number of deer

content.question: At time <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow> </math> years, a forest preserve has a population of 1500 deer. If the rate of growth of the population is modeled by <math> <mrow> <mi>R</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2000</mn> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mn>0.23</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math> deer per year, what is the population at time <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </math> ?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
